name: Lon.e.Wol.fJac.k (2013)
description:
Lon.e.Wol.fJac.k was a survival game made over a weekend in late 2013 for the Super BR Jam, a game jam with Brazilian devs that was part of a bundle for charity.

  • WASD: movement
  • Shift: run
  • Mouse Click: use weapon/tool
  • Q/E or 1,2,3 : switch weapon/tool
  • Space: jump
  • Gather resources & survive for as long as possible. 

And remember: faith only takes you so far, the rest is up to you.

(i.e.: you can stun demons with the cross, but you'll have to axe them to death)

-----------------------

The project started as an adventure/survival game, and ended being a weird commentary about my life at the time. The video explainer ended up winning it a prize at the VI Cinemundo Festival in 2014.

I was originally going to work with a couple of artists, but ended up soloing . Once again, Leo Perantoni cooked up wonderful audioscapes overnight, taking a very simple game to a new atmospheric level.

I had lost the source & binaries, but found them again a few weeks ago on an old hard drive, so I decided to try to restore it  'as-is'. You can download the original version for Windows (which plays and looks a bit nicer!)
